title: 14-year-old charged with shooting 10-year-old in hotel room
content:
NASHVILLE, TN (WSMV) -
A 14-year-old boy faced a detention hearing on Monday after shooting a 10-year-old boy inside a Nashville hotel early Saturday morning.
Marterious Boyd was staying at the Regency Inn and Suites Hotel on Hampton Street with his aunt, his aunt's children and grandchildren, according to the aunt.
The aunt said she stepped outside the room around midnight while the children were playing inside. Police said the children were playing with toy guns, which is when a 14-year-old somehow produced a real gun.
Police said Boyd was playing with a toy cap gun and pointing it at other boys who were in the room playing video games.
The 14-year-old, who has not been identified by police, had a .22 caliber revolver, pointed it at Boyd and pulled the trigger.
Boyd is in stable condition at Vanderbilt University Medical Center.
The 14-year-old was charged with aggravated assault and unlawful gun possession.
